captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Kha’Zix, the Voidreaver.
Change is good.
Kha’Zix is a melee assassin who utilizes quick movements and invisibility to take down his foes.
In addition, Kha’Zix actually evolves over the course of the match, upgrading his already potent abilities with new features.
Whenever Kha’Zix learns a new rank of his ultimate, he can evolve himself, adding a unique effect to any of his four active abilities.
Note that because you can only rank your ultimate three times per game, you can only evolve three of your four abilities each game.
Kha’Zix’s passive is Unseen Threat. Any time Kha’Zix becomes unseen by his opponents, he gains a buff called Unseen Threat that lasts until he attacks an enemy champion.
If Kha’Zix attacks an enemy champion while wearing this buff, he deals bonus damage, slows his target, and consumes the buff.
Taste Their Fear damages target enemy on activation.
However, if the target has no nearby allies, Kha’Zix will see the target marked, and Taste Their Fear will deal bonus damage.
Kha’Zix may learn Evolved Claws, increasing the range of his basic attacks and Taste Their Fear.
Additionally, Evolved Claws causes Taste Their Fear to deal further bonus damage to isolated targets based on their missing health.
I recommend both maxing and Evolving Taste Their Fear as soon as possible in order to quickly assassinate enemy champions.
Void Spike fires out and explodes on the first enemy it hits, damaging all surrounding foes.
If Kha’Zix is within the explosion, he is also healed.
Evolved Spike Racks will cause Kha’Zix to fire three sets of spikes in a cone.
These Void Spikes are now able to apply his passive, Unseen Threat, dealing further damage and slowing all enemies hit.
Take Void Spike at level 1 and max it primarily if you need extra health sustain to survive a tough lane or the jungle.
Evolve it if you’re looking for the extra farming and chasing potential by applying Unseen Threat.
Leap makes Kha’Zix to jump to a nearby target area, damaging all enemies he lands near.
With Evolved Wings, Leap’s range is greatly increased and will immediately refresh its cooldown if Kha’Zix kills or assists in the kill of an enemy champion.
Take a point early, but I would generally recommend maxing it last. However, evolving it will greatly help you get into fights and continue chasing as your enemies fall.
Void Assault is Kha’Zix’s ultimate. When activated, Kha’Zix briefly stealths and gains bonus movement speed.
Void Assault may be activated twice in a short time frame before going on cooldown.
If Kha’Zix learns Evolved Active Camouflage, he may cast Void Assault a third time and takes reduced damage while stealthed.
Absolutely take points in Void Assault whenever possible to access more evolutions.
Choose Evolved Active Camouflage if you’re looking for a larger impact in team fights, providing increased durability and slipperiness.
When jungling as Kha’Zix, remember that neutral monsters can be isolated from other neutral monsters.
So, when taking on tough monster camps, kill off the weakest ones first, allowing Taste Their Fear to hit the biggest one for bonus damage.
Kha’Zix can easily gank from the jungle as Leap will put you into range to first land a basic attack for Unseen Threat.
Then, wait until your opponent is isolated from his minions for Taste Their Fear.

After Kha’Zix forces Malzahar’s Flash, he simply waits in the Brush to come out again, landing the exact same combo by Leaping in for Unseen Threat followed by Void Spike and Taste Their Fear for the kill.
Because the Dragon can never have other neutral monsters nearby, it will always be isolated for Taste Their Fear.
Because of this, Kha’Zix is exceptional at killing the Dragon, even when alone.
A simple Vision Ward makes sure no enemies are watching, and Kha’Zix takes out the Dragon quite easily.
When playing as a solo laner, constantly look for openings to strike. Taste Their Fear into a basic attack nets some easy harass.
Kha’Zix jumps into the brush to re-trigger Unseen Threat and dives back in.
He lands it with a basic attack again and follows up with Taste Their Fear and Void Spike.
Upon reaching level 3, Leap enables even more harassment, pushing Rumble back again.
Upon reaching Level 6 or 7, Kha’Zix can easily engage for a kill. A basic attack with Unseen Threat and Void Spike opens the fight.
Kha’Zix waits for a second and then activates Void Assault, which deals significant damage as it reactivates Unseen Threat, and pushes Rumble back away from his minions.
Once isolated, Taste Their Fear deals incredible damage while he saves Leap to dodge Rumble ultimate, picking up the kill and surviving.
Evolved Active Camouflage is awesome when diving enemies near their turrets.
Watch as Kha’Zix times Void Assault right before turret shots land, blocking a large portion of the damage while fighting Miss Fortune and while escaping after the kill.
Remember that Kha’Zix relies on stealth and mobility to survive in fights.
Initially, Evolved Spike Racks makes harassment easy, as Void Spike will apply Unseen Threat every time he pokes.
However, Kha’Zix gets greedy. He tries to open in onto Miss Fortune using Void Assault and Leap.
While Kha’Zix deals some great initial damage with Taste Their Fear and basic attacks, the enemy turret prevents Void Assault from really saving him from counter attack, and he falls quickly.
Instead, use your mobility to find squishy enemies out in the open.
Using Void Assault, Kha’Zix gets the drop on Miss Fortune, killing her with Leap and Taste Their Fear, following up onto Morgana and forcing her down as well.
I recommend building Kha’Zix for all-out physical damage while almost ignoring durability, relying on stealth and quick movements for survival instead. Here’s an example build:
Take Attack Damage Marks, Armor Seals, Magic Resist per Level Glyphs, and Attack Damage Quintessences
Run 21/9/0 masteries, taking physical damage increases in Offense with added Armor and Health in Defense.
When jungling, always take Smite. Outside of that, consider Ignite for champion-killing, Exhaust to lock down and chase your prey, and Flash for increased mobility.
Open with Boots of Speed and Health Potions, plus a few quick Doran’s Blades.
Your first major purchases will be Brutalizer and Bloodthirster or Sanguine Blade for heavily increased burst damage when assassinating your foes.
From here choose upgraded boots: Ninja Tabi or Mercury Treads will help you survive, while Boots of Mobility will help you assassinate.
As you scale into the late game, pick up Last Whisper, Guardian Angel, Maw of Malmortius, and Youmuu’s Ghostblade.
Thanks for tuning into the Kha’Zix Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel above and leave us your comments just below the video!

comments.text: Rengar or kha zix? Pls fucking help me i love them both﻿
comments.author: Lance Sucayan

comments.text:
They are both good assassins, i bought rengo the other day and i love him, 
but i also wanna get kha`zix now too. Honestly, I think the main difference 
between the two are the early games. Rengo`s early ganks are not quite as 
strong because he doesnt have a real gap closer, while kha`zix has his 
leap. But rengo is better at assasinating people who are pushing alone in 
lane and dueling. So the real difference is whether you want strong early 
ganks or good dueling/single target burst, but i think you should try both 
before buying either.

comments.text:
hes not rly as top efficient as before the huge nerf but hes still viable

take teleport/flash instead of ignite/flash because most opponents will out 
trade before lv6

max q and evolve it first to win lane, most people think maxing w is the 
thing nowadays but kha was recently nerfed on his w's dmg and the cooldown 
was extended

just stick to the upper part of the lane in the bushes, everytime ur enemy 
goes out of his minion wave to farm, punish him for it by hitting with w, 
then q, then auto for the passive slow and extra dmg. remember that kha's 
dmg was nerfed pretty hard so if u poke ur opponents hp down semi low. dont 
go all in cuz ur prob just gunna waste a lot of mana with ur jump and end 
up not getting a kill

also remember that khazix isnt super manly, dont play him like those no 
skill darius and riven fags, to win ur lane or at least not be completely 
pushed out of it, u need to be strategic, make good use out of ur passive, 
and conserve mana. save e for gank escapes or guaranteed kills

btw kha top takes a lot of practice, hes a lot like nidalee top, u need to 
practice him in a ton of games if u want to beat the more popular champions 
(riven, darius, irelia, maokai)

oh and for the build path, u need to buy at least 3 doran blades early in 
order to compete against ur lane opponent, hes a lot like rengar in the 
aspect. once u have those, go for a brutilizer, then do whatever the fuck u 
want
my late game build is this:
ghost blade
hydra
tri force
tanky boots
randuins/guardian angel
6th item is optional, bloodthirster and spirit visage are good choices

comments.text: Invoker is actually harder then you think, 15 skills total :/
comments.author: TheMooseMen

comments.text:
+Ramiro Quevedo Exactly man.  Exactly the same feel I had!  I played lol 
for 1500 games and I didn't know what the fuck was going on.  I think it's 
much more complicated than lol, and I've played it both!  Any lol player 
who has played DOTA 2 would agree with this!  Just know, because the game 
is harder, and your skills are alot more powerful, there's so much comeback 
potential, and it's damn satisfying.  Yeah, he actually is, because he 
requires so much micro management.  1 meepo dies, all meepo's die.  I had a 
really pro meepo friend, who late game started grinding 2 jungles and 2 
lanes and got out of control in farm.  He surtenly is sick if you can 
control him!  Invoker is the second harder character to control in my 
opinion, because he has 9 skills.  You have a list so you can memorize them 
that way, but it'll surtenly take a few games to get used to!  He's one of 
my favorites to play though.
comments.author: Sven Van Dyck

comments.text:
I played one game thinking i was at least going to understand whats going 
on but i was as lost as my first match in a moba, one would think that 700 
won matches in lol would make you understand dota but damn its complicated. 
BTW meepo is very well known by moba players as the hardest character to 
play as in mobas.
comments.author: Ramiro Quevedo

comments.text:
+Ramiro Quevedo Broodmother and Fenix are great picks, but I'd definetly 
recommend some other characters.  If you're a beginner, and you want to try 
a support, play Crystalmaiden and lvl his W (second skill)  for a carry I'd 
recommend Wraith King (since he only has 1 active skill)  or perhaps 
lifestealer or something!  Jungle is going to be hard, and I'd recommend 
trying them in custom map first!   My first jungler was enigma, but he 
isn't the easiest character.  Though he is a really good jungler. 
 Character for advanced players are definetly Invoker, Meepo, Lonedruid, I 
woudn't go near Shadow Fiend because he's super squishy.  I wish you good 
luck!
comments.author: Sven Van Dyck

is very satisfying.

right, he can still dish out a lot of damage.
